intro: Leptorkis walkerae, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 15-30 cm and thrives in warm, humid environments. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, making it a popular ornamental plant. It requires well-draining soil and indirect sunlight to flourish.
